thread.title: Lenovo Vibe B with 4.5-inch display and quad-core SoC launched in India for Rs 5,799
thread.title_full: Lenovo Vibe B with 4.5-inch display and quad-core SoC launched in India for Rs 5,799

title: Lenovo Vibe B with 4.5-inch display and quad-core SoC launched in India for Rs 5,799
text: Lenovo Vibe B with 4.5-inch display and quad-core SoC launched in India... Lenovo Vibe B with 4.5-inch display and quad-core SoC launched in India for Rs 5,799 By March 10, 2017 “The Vibe B features 1GB RAM, 8GB of expandable storage and 5MP/2MP cameras” Lenovo has quietly released a new budget smartphone in India, according to Mumbai-based retailer Mahesh Telecom . Called the Vibe B, the phone was initially released in select European markets in October last year.The Vibe B is a compact device featuring a 4.5-inch display with a resolution of 480 x 840 pixels. It is powered by a quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor clocked at 1.0GHz, paired with 1GB of RAM. It features just 8GB of storage, expandable via microSD up to 32GB. The rear camera on the device is a 5MP unit with LED flash, but surprisingly it’s fixed focus. There’s also a 2MP front camera for selfies. The battery on board is a 2,000mAh unit, and it’s user replaceable as well. The Vibe B runs Android 6.0 Marshmallow with Lenovo’s Vibe UI on top. The device is 4G compatible with dual-SIM, but it’s unclear if it comes with VoLTE support. It also features an FM Radio.The Vibe B is priced at Rs 5,799, and will be available offline starting today. Online availability hasn’t been announced as yet.
